ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Your present age in years:
Notes: Age in Years

ElementDescription: (Employment status) Are you presently:
Notes: 1= EMPLOYED FULLTIME; 2= EMPLOYED PARTTIME; 3= UNEMPLOYED; 4= RETIRED; 5= FULLTIME HOMEMAKER; 6= STUDENT

ElementDescription: What is the highest level of education/highest degree or level of school you have completed?
Notes: 1= NO FORMAL EDUCATION; 2= SOME GRADE SCHOOL; 3= COMPLETED GRADE SCHOOL; 4= SOME HIGH SCHOOL; 5= COMPLETED HIGH SCHOOL; 6= SOME COLLEGE; 7= COMPLETED COLLEGE; 8= SOME GRADUATE WORK; 9= A GRADUATE DEGREE

ElementDescription: What is your race/ethnicity?
Notes: 1= White, not of hispanic origin; 2= Black, not of hispanic origin; 3= Hispanic/Latino/Latina/Latinx; 4= Asian/Pacific Islander; 5= American indian/Alaska Native; 6= Other; 7= Multi-racial; 999= Prefer not to respond

ElementDescription: (Marital Status) Are you:
Notes: 1= SINGLE; 2= MARRIED; 3= DIVORCED OR SEPARATED

ElementDescription: When did you last drink an alcoholic beverage?
Notes: 1= TODAY; 2= YESTERDAY; 3= WITHIN THE LAST TWO DAYS; 4= WITHIN THE LAST FOUR DAYS; 5= WITHIN THE LAST WEEK; 6= WITHIN THE LAST TWO WEEKS; 7= WITHIN THE LAST MONTH; 8= WITHIN THE LAST TWO MONTH; 9= WITHIN THE LAST THREE MONTHS; 10= WITHIN THE LAST FOUR MONTHS

ElementDescription: IF TODAY: WHAT TIME?
Notes: TT:TT AM or PM

ElementDescription: About how old were you when you first drank an alcoholic beverage?
Notes: Age in Years

ElementDescription: About how many times in your life have you consumed alcohol?
Notes: 1= 1 OR 2 TIMES; 2= 3 TO 5 TIMES; 3= 6 TO 10 TIMES; 4= 11 TO 49 TIMES; 5= 50 TO 99 TIMES; 6= MORE THAN 99 TIMES

ElementDescription: During the past 30 days, on about how many days did you drink alcohol?
On the average., how often in the last six months did you drink alcohol?
Notes: 1= MORE THAN ONCE EACH DAY; 2= ONCE A DAY; 3= FOUR TO SIX DAYS A WEEK; 4= TWO OR THREE DAYS A WEEK; 5= ONCE A WEEK; 6= TWO OR THREE DAYS A MONTH; 7= ONCE A MONTH; 8= SEVERAL TIMES, BUT LESS THAN ONCE A MONTH; 9= ONCE OR TWICE

ElementDescription: Now tell us the different types of alcoholic beverages you have ever consumed.
Notes: BEER; WINE OR WINE COOLERS; HARD LIQUOR; OTHER

ElementDescription: What type of alcoholic beverages did you generally drink over the last six months?
Notes: 1= BEER; 2= WINE OR WINE COOLERS; 3= HARD LIQUOR; 4= OTHER

ElementDescription: Beer - How many drinks do you typically have at one time?
Wine - How many drinks do you typically have at one time?
Liquor (1oz. shot, drink) - How many drinks do you typically have at one time?
Other - How many drinks do you typically have at one time?
Beer - How many drinks do you typically have in one day (a 24-hour period)?
Wine - How many drinks do you typically have in one day (a 24-hour period)?
Liquor (1oz. shot, drink) - How many drinks do you typically have in one day (a 24-hour period)?
Other - How many drinks do you typically have in one day (a 24-hour period)?
A CRAVING FOR ALCOHOL IS ONLY A STRONG URGE OR  DESIRE TO DRINK ALCOHOL.
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: A CRAVING FOR ALCOHOL IS ANY URGE OR DESIRE TO DRINK ALCOHOL, EVEN A WEAK ONE.
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: On a scale of 0 to 10 where 0 is not at all, and 10 is the most imaginable, how much do you crave an alcoholic beverage when you've gone without a drink for 1-2 days?
On a scale of 0 to 10 where 0 is not at all, and 10 is the most imaginable, how much do you crave an alcoholic beverage right now?
INTENSITY - HOW STRONG HAS AN AVERAGE URGE BEEN?:
Notes: 1= None/Not At All; 2= Weak; 3= Somewhat Weak; 4= Neutral; 5= Somewhat Strong; 6= Strong; 7= A Great Deal/Very Strong

ElementDescription: On the average, HOW FREQUENTLY (how many times a day) have you experienced craving for alcohol DURING THE PAST WEEK.
On the average, How LONG has the craving for alcohol lasted DURING THE PAST WEEK?
Notes: 1= Less than one Minute; 2= 1-5 Minutes; 3= 6-10 Minutes; 4= 11-15 Minutes; 5= 15-30 Minutes; 6= 31-45 Minutes; 7= 46-60 Minutes; 8= 1-2 Hours; 9=  More than 2 Hours

ElementDescription: Have you ever tried to quit drinking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: IF YES: How many times have you tried to quit?
IF YES: What is the longest period of time that you've been able to quit?
Notes: Number of Days

ElementDescription: Number of previous Inpatient treatments for alcohol:
Notes: 1= No previous inpatient treatment; 2= 1; 3= 2; 4= 3-5; 5= 6 or more

ElementDescription: Number of previous outpatient treatments for alcohol:
Notes: 1= No previous outpatient treatment; 2= 1; 3= 2; 4= 3-5; 5= 6 or more

ElementDescription: Age at which drinking first became a problem?
Notes: Age in Years

ElementDescription: If you would try to quit drinking now, how confident are you that you could go for one year without drinking?
Notes: 1= NOT CONFIDENT; 2= A LITTLE CONFIDENT; 3= MODERATELY CONFIDENT; 4= VERY CONFIDENT; 5= EXTREMELY CONFIDENT

ElementDescription: (Short Form) Factor 1: Compulsivity (COMP), urges and desires in anticipation of loss of control over drinking.
Notes: Average sum of questions 15, 17, 22

ElementDescription: (Short Form) Factor 2: Expectancy (XPCT), urges and desires to drink in anticipation of the positive benefits of drinking.
Notes: Average sum of questions 33, 7, 46

ElementDescription: (Short Form) Factor 3: Purposefulness (PURP), urges and desires coupled with intent and planning to drink.
Notes: Average sum of questions 12, 27, 43 (These questions are reversed key items, the item raw scored is subtracted from 8 to yield the actual raw score.)

ElementDescription: (Short Form) Factor 4: Emotionality (EMOT), urges and desires to drink in anticipation of relief from withdrawal/negative affect.
Notes: Average sum of questions 28, 34, 39

ElementDescription: (Long Form) Factor 1: Compulsivity (COMP), urges and desires in anticipation of loss of control over drinking.
(Long Form) Factor 2: Expectancy (XPCT), urges and desires to drink in anticipation of the positive benefits of drinking.
Notes: Average sum of questions 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 33, 46

ElementDescription: (Long Form) Factor 3: Purposefulness (PURP), urges and desires coupled with intent and planning to drink.
Notes: Average sum of questions 2, 6, 12, 27, 29, 36, 38, 43 (These questions are reversed key items, the item raw scored is subtracted from 8 to yield the actual raw score.)

ElementDescription: (Long Form) Factor 4: Emotionality (EMOT), urges and desires to drink in anticipation of relief from withdrawal/negative affect.
Notes: Average sum of questions 28, 34, 39

ElementDescription: Alcohol Craving Questionnaire-Short Form Revised Total Score
Notes: [acq_now7] + (8-[acq_now12]) + [acq_now15] + [acq_now17] + [acq_now22] + (8-[acq_now27]) + [acq_now28] + [acq_now33] + [acq_now34] + [acq_now39] + (8-[acq_now43]) + [acq_now46]

ElementDescription: Alcohol Consumption Questionnaire General Cravings Index
Notes: Calculated by averaging all ACQ items; 999 = Missing value

ElementDescription: Alcohol Consumption Questionnaire Total Score
Notes: Total sum of all ACQ questions; 999=Missing value

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Control Subscale Score
Notes: Sum of (acq_now1, acq_now31, acq_now25, acq_now15, acq_now16, tiff8, tiff20, tiff23, tiff36)

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Desire Subscale Score

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Intent Subscale Score

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Positive Subscale Score

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Relief Subscale Score

ElementDescription: Tiffany Alcohol Scale: Total Score
